description: This vehicle will replace the one you just chose.

Only 2 vehicles can qualify for the Blue Badge discount on a single travel day. These will be the last 2 vehicles nominated for the discount on that day (before midnight).
You need to pay the full Congestion Charge for any vehicles nominated before these final 2.
The nominated vehicles do not have to be owned by the Blue Badge holder. However, the Blue Badge holder must be travelling in the vehicle when it is driven within the Congestion Charge zone.
If a nominated vehicle is driven into the Congestion Charge zone for any reason other than to transport the Blue Badge holder, the standard daily Congestion Charge must be paid.

The Blue Badge discount only applies to the Congestion Charge. You will need to pay the Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) charge to drive your vehicle in the zone if it doesn't meet the ULEZ emissions standards.

Based on the vehicle details entered and information held by the DVLA and TfL today, your vehicle is registered for a 100% discount from the Congestion Charge. If you believe this information is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, add this vehicle or apply for a discount, then you can continue with this process.
This may change - always check to see if you need to pay to drive within the zone.

Based on the vehicle details entered and information held by the DVLA and TfL today, this vehicle is exempt from the Congestion Charge. If you believe this information is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, add this vehicle or apply for a discount, then you can continue.
This may change - always check to see if you need to pay to drive within the zone.
If the number plate (Vehicle Registration Mark) is correct but the description shown is wrong, you can still pay for this vehicle.
Vehicle information is provided to TfL by the DVLA, so you'll need to let the DVLA know if your details are wrong or need to be updated.
We do not hold details for this vehicle
